newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: KLASCO APPROVES SHARE CAPITAL BOOST.
newsitem.headline: KLASCO APPROVES SHARE CAPITAL BOOST.

text.p: Lithuania's Klaipeda Stevedoring Company (KLASCO) general shareholders' meeting on Monday decided to double its share capital from internal reserves, daily Lietuvos rytas reported on Tuesday.
The shareholders voted on Monday to increase the share capital of the company by 128.988 million litas to almost 258 million litas, the newspaper said.
The company is 84 percent state-run and the new share issue will be acquired proportionally by the present shareholders, the newspaper said.
The company reported last week that it was operating succesfully during the first quarter of 1997 and had a net profit of 8.458 million litas in the first three months of the year.
The company also said that it reloaded 2.29 million tonnes of cargo during the first three months of the year compared to 1.56 million tones in the same period in 1996.
The Lithuanian government has included the company on a list of 14 key state enterprises to be privatised.
It is the largest stevedoring company operating in Lithuania.
